master.commit_message:
lsusb -h fixups

Previous change to make `lsusb -h` not return an error forgot to account
that the help is also printed when an invalid option is used.

Signed-off-by: Greg Kroah-Hartman <gregkh@linuxfoundation.org>

Merge pull request #163 from naruto-abc/dev

lsusb: fix incorrect variable type and unalignments when dumping hid …

Merge pull request #167 from lnykryn/sc

usb-devices: make shellcheck happy

Merge pull request #168 from aurel32/master

Fix a typo in usb-spec.h

lsusb -h returns an error

Fix up the issue where 'lsusb -h' will return an error to the shell, it
succeeded, so return 0 instead.

Signed-off-by: Greg Kroah-Hartman <gregkh@linuxfoundation.org>

Fix a typo in usb-spec.h

Rigth => Right

Signed-off-by: Aurelien Jarno <aurelien@aurel32.net>

usb-devices: make shellcheck happy

This change should not make any difference in behavior,
but fixes all shellcheck warnings besides https://www.shellcheck.net/wiki/SC3043

Also replacing 'var=`cat file`' with 'read' makes usb-devices much faster.

Old:
real	0m0,849s
user	0m0,388s
sys	0m0,531s

New:
real	0m0,245s
user	0m0,109s
sys	0m0,155s

Signed-off-by: Lukas Nykryn <lnykryn@redhat.com>

Fix misalignments in hid device descripptor.

Extra spaces should be added when printing below lines:
'Report Descriptors:
   ** UNAVAILABLE **'

Signed-off-by: Dingyan Li <18500469033@163.com>

Fix an incorrect length value in hid descriptor.

While dumping descriptors of a USB hid device, I saw a weird line:
'Report Descriptor: (length is -1)'

This is because variable 'n' is used to hold a potential negative
integer value even though it's an unsigned int type in function
dump_hid_device. When usb_control_msg() fails, overflow happens.
It will always pass the 'if' statement below and call dump_report_desc(),
where this weird line finally shows up.

To fix it, an int type should be used to avoid overflow.

Signed-off-by: Dingyan Li <18500469033@163.com>

Merge pull request #165 from kristofferkoch/master

usbreset: Allow idProduct and idVendor to be 0

usbreset: Allow idProduct and idVendor to be 0

idProduct at least, is valid as 0, and I guess idVendor can
typically be left at 0 while developing some new usb thing.

Signed-off-by: Kristoffer Ellersgaard Koch <kristoffer.koch@gmail.com>
